name: Chocolate-Cinnamon Swirl Cake
author: SAPHIRA
summary: Recipe passed to me a few months ago by an aunt. Make sure to use high quality cocoa for a richer flavor. This will keep well in a fridge and can be reheated in the microwave (covered loosely with a paper towel or napkin).
ingredients: ¾ cup semisweet chocolate chips, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Mix together sugar, cocoa powder, and cinnamon in a small bowl; set topping aside
Combine butter and cream cheese in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
Add sugar and mix until well blended
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition
Sift in flour and baking powder and blend until thoroughly combined
Pour 1/2 of the batter into the prepared baking dish and sprinkle with 1/2 of the cinnamon topping
Spread remaining batter on top and sprinkle with remaining topping
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 60 minutes
Cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes
